intro: Parosela painteri, commonly known as the Painted Parosela, is a rare flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae, which includes ferns and their allies. The plant is characterized by its delicate, intricately veined leaves that display a striking array of colors, ranging from deep purples to bright greens. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found growing on rocky substrates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Parosela painteri is considered a vulnerable species.
